Defining Check In/Check Out/Get Options

When you perform check in/check out/get actions, Serena ChangeMan Version Manager defaults to the following options:

  • Prompts you if a workfile already exists during a check out.

  • Leaves a read-only copy of the workfile in the workfile location after a check in.

  • Copies out a read-only workfile when you perform a get.

  • Gets or checks out a revision whether or not it is newer than the workfile.

If you find that you usually change these default options when you perform check in/check out/get actions, Version Manager enables you to change these default settings to fit your working style.

To change check in/check out/get options:

  1. Select View | Options. The Options dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  2. Select options from the Check In/Out Options group.

    • To delete workfiles from the workfile location after a successful check in, select the Delete workfile after check in check box.
    • To make workfiles writable when you perform a get, deselect the Get read-only revision check box.
    • To choose an option other than Prompt when a workfile already exists, select an option from the If Workfile Exists drop-down menu. The other options include Overwrite, which adds the workfile even if a duplicate workfile exists, or Don't Overwrite, which does not add the workfile to the workfile location.
    • To get or check out only those revisions that are newer than the workfiles, select the Get only if revision is newer than workfile check box.

  3. Click OK.
